executable.title: Fiber Post Processing
executable.description: Removes fibers outside of a mask

image.name: attributeFileName
image.label: Attribute File Name
image.description: attribute filename in .nrrd, .nhdr, etc, such as a probability mask, or FA, MD, etc. Set by default as a binary mask. This parameter is used to crop the beginning and the end of each fiber or to mask the fiber bundle and remove any fiber considered outside of this mask (determined by the threshold parameter).

string-enumeration.name: attribute
string-enumeration.label: Attribute Boolean
string-enumeration.description: Set by default to binary mode, set the value to nonbinary

float.name: threshold
float.label: Threshold value
float.description: Threshold value between 0 and 1. If the percentage of the fiber outside of the mask is above this value, the fiber is removed.

integer.name: outputAttributeFiberFileName
integer.label: Output Attribute Fiber File Name
integer.description: Need to be set at 1 if you want to have an output file and its intersection with the mask visualizable through Slicer.
